values.comments:
This class is a continuation of MATH 360, a study of the foundations of differential and integral calculus, including the real numbers and elementary topology, continuous and differentiable functions, uniform convergence of series of functions, and inverse and implicit function theorems. MATH 508-509 is a masters level version of this course.

Students found the class challenging yet approachable. One student said it was the best math class he had ever taken at Penn.

Students said the professor was very clear in concepts, communication and writing. Her lectures were clear and easily understandable.

Students said the exams and problem sets were almost always straightforward and fair.
